dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 949 IH: Insular Area Medicaid Parity Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Sablan (for himself, Mr. Torres of New York, Ms. Plaskett, Mr. Takano, Mr. Veasey, Mr. Trone, Mr. Case, Ms. Barragán, Ms. Bonamici, Ms. Meng, Ms. Lee of California, Mrs. González-Colón, Ms. Moore of Wisconsin, Mrs. Radewagen, Mrs. Napolitano, Mr. Moylan, Mr. García of Illinois, Ms. Chu, and Ms. Norton) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend title XI of the Social Security Act to eliminate the general Medicaid funding limitations for territories of the United States, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Insular Area Medicaid Parity Act.

section.header: Elimination of general Medicaid funding limitations (cap) for territories

subsection.text: Section 1108 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1308) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (f), in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking subsection (g) and (h) and inserting subsections (g), (h), and (i);
in subsection (g)(2), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking and paragraphs (3) and (5) and inserting , paragraphs (3) and (5), and subsection (i); and
by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: Subsections (f) and (g) shall not apply to Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa beginning with fiscal year 2023.

paragraph.text: Section 1902(j) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a(j)) is amended by striking , the limitation in section 1108(f),.
Section 1903(u) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396b(u)) is amended by striking paragraph (4).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply beginning with fiscal year 2023.
